question: Which three cricket world cups are consecutively won by Australia?
explanation: 1999, 2003, 2007 Cricket World Cups are the three cricket world cups consecutively won by Australia. In 1999 the event was hosted by England. In the final, Australia dismissed Pakistan for 132 and then reached the target in less than 20 overs and with eight wickets in hand. South Africa, Zimbabwe and Kenya hosted the 2003 World Cup. In the final, Australia made 359 runs for the loss of two wickets, the largest ever total in a final, defeating India by 125 runs. In 2007 the tournament was hosted by the West Indies. Australia defeated Sri Lanka in the final by 53 runs (D/L) in farcical light conditions, and extended their undefeated run in the World Cup, winning three straight championships.
